ygData.subject: Re: Songs
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah the bards have to travel more than any other class. Its pretty fun too. You really get to see the world. Try traveling even more, its fun to see the
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah the bards have to travel more than any other class. Its pretty fun
too. You really get to see the world. Try traveling even more, its fun
to see the reactions of players when you tell them in halas that you've
come from kelethin, and even more when you tell the people in oggk or
grobb(well outta the guards' views atleast) where you've come from. The
bards are supposed to travel, and IMO any class should see the world.
You might not level as fast, but saying that you've visited every city
by level 10 or so can turn quite a few heads. ;)

"Daniel P. Sniderman" wrote:
>
> From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <slide@...>
>
> I had JUST made level 8 - and at first was pretty annoyed at not having easy
> access to the song. I found a high level bard to lead me to Kelethin and
> the bard's guild (he needed the 11th spell). The trip was long and boring -
> but it gave me an opportunity to practice my lute playing...
>
> After getting the Bard's guild in Kelethin - confirmed I didn't have enough
> cash to buy it (which I expected) - so I figure what the hell - I'll try to
> meet some people and operate out of the area. I had a great time - met new
> people, saw new sights, and killed new critters. The Steamfont Mountains
> are particularly cool. The windmills are particularly impressive (ooc -
> makes me want to go back and visit Holland again).
>
> If it wasn't for that - I'd probably still be operating out of E Commons and
> N. Ro - and not "see the world". OOC - I think it's a smart design feature
> by the makers - as it forces you to play the bard - roaming the world,
> seeing the sights meeting new people...
>
> The more I play this game - the more I like it - and the less I liked my UOL
> experience. I like the social interaction of online - and I really NEVER
> met anyone in UOL - too worried about getting jumped and your stuff stolen.
> And (at least while I was online) the buddy list thingy never worked.
>
> A lot of people complain about the quirks of the Name filter - but I
> ultimately like it. I got bit - It rejected "Slide" which I've played on
> many an online (and solo) game - but big deal - in this land the spelling is
> different and hence "Slyde". I'll gladly give that up to never see
> "k3W1d00dZ"!
>
> Slyde
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Kyle <ksibbald@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Sunday, April 25, 1999 8:00 AM
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Songs
>
> > From: "Kyle" <ksibbald@...>
> >
> > I believe that the bards in the back room of the guild hall sell a
> > smattering of songs. I know that the 8th level song, Lament, is only
> > available in Kelethin as is 11 and 13 I think. A few higher level songs
> seem
> > available at all bard guilds but most of them will be hidden in other
> remote
> > places.
> >
> > Sure, tehre are some lists around on the internet listing the locations of
> > most of the songs but I think it is more fun to ask fellow bards in-game
> > where they might be.
> >
> > Good Journey,
> >
> > Sineras (Cazic-Thule)
> >

> > songs.
> > Not sure where to start looking for them or if they are quests. The guild
> > leader
> > in Kelethin only gives out drums for four spiderling silks.
> >
> > I would like for the information either on the list or emailed to me
> > directly

> > Thanks in advance,
